column4: Can you install ubuntu on a drive that has data on it, without formatting the drive or making a partition?

It's just that at the moment, I have 2 hard drives. One with vista, and one with an old installation of XP on it. They are both almost full with data. I wanted to just delete XP and install ubuntu on the second drive
what do you think is my best course of action?
